text: is a Japanese city in Nara Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Tenri" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 960. ==History== The Isonokami Shrine is in Tenri. A town grew up around the shrine.Nussbaum, "Isonokami-jinjū" at p. 401. According to tradition, Tenri was the site of the Hirotaka Palace (Hirotak no miya) when Emperor Ninken lived there.Koch, W. (1904). Japan; Geschichte nach japanischen Quellen und ethnographische Skizzen. Mit einem Stammbaum des Kaisers von Japan, p. 13. Tenri is the center of the Tenrikyo religion. ==Gallery== File:IsonokamiGate.jpg|Gate of Isonokami-jinjū ==Related pages== * Capital of Japan ==References== == Other websites == * Tenri City website Category:Cities in Nara Prefecture Category:Tenrikyo
title: Tenri, Nara
